message.content: This question requires some knowledge of decomposition. When a dead body is exposed to the air, it will eventually undergo decomposition. Over time, the flesh will break down and decay, leaving behind only the skeleton. Option (A) is incorrect because the body will not become hot after death. Option (B) is incorrect because the body will not remain fresh when exposed to the air. Option (C) is incorrect because the body will not become wet, but rather dry out as decomposition occurs. Only option (D) accurately represents the final stage of decomposition.

Over time, the body will break down and only the skeletal remains will be left. Option (A) is incorrect because a dead body exposed to air does not become hot. Option (B) is also incorrect because the body decomposes and does not remain fresh. Option (C) is incorrect because the body will not remain wet during decomposition.

Option (A) is incorrect because the remains would not remain hot. Option (B) is incorrect because the remains would not stay fresh. Option (C) is incorrect because the remains would not remain wet.

Initially, the body will undergo autolysis, which is the breakdown of cells by their own enzymes. Eventually, this leads to the breakdown of tissues and organs. As time passes, the flesh and soft tissues will gradually decompose, leaving only the skeleton behind. Therefore, the correct answer is (D) skeletal remains. The other options, (A) hot remains, (B) fresh remains, and (C) wet remains, do not accurately depict the decomposition process and are not scientifically correct.
